statement:
Let $S$ be a set and $B$ a filter basis in $S$. A function
$f:S \to \mathbb{R}$ possesses limit on $B$, iff for every
$\epsilon > 0$ there exists $X\in B$ such that the oscillation of $f$ on
$X$ is less than $\epsilon$.

For a proof of this theorem see[@cite:Zorich].

[99]{} V., Zorich, [*Mathematical Analysis I*]{}, pp. 132ff, First Ed.,
Springer-Verlag, 2004.
names: Cauchy criterion for the existence of a limit of a function
